This causes the entire string to be written as a single line, which is why it prints 123 instead of 1. To fix this, you can use the "\t" character as a line break, which is what the PrintWriter.write method expects.

Regarding the second code, you are creating a new Sandwich object before writing to the file, which is why you are getting empty strings. To fix this, you should call the sandwich object that you already created in the makeSandwich() method before writing to the file. You can do this by moving the line "sandwich = new Sandwich()" to before the dateFormat.format(date) line in the makeSandwich() method.
